info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 4:22PM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Stonewall County through 445 PM CST... At 422 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Old Glory, or 11 miles northeast of Hamlin, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Old Glory and Us-380 Near The Haskell-Stonewall County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
